name: American Airlines 777-200 International Business Class (Domestic First): Dallas Fort Worth - Miami
description:

Date of Travel: 16 JULY 2017
Aircraft: Boeing 777-200
Tail: N768AA
Livery: AA standard plain grey 
Route: DFW-MIA
Weather on Departure: Scattered clouds, winds calm 
Weather on Arrival: Scattered clouds, winds calm 
Airborne Time: 2h22
Miles: 1120
Remarks: None

Thanks for finding my video and pressing play! 

One of the great things about domestic flights in the USA is the chance to fly widebody aircraft on some routes. DFW to MIA is one of those, and AA operate 777s on this route on a couple of flights a day. 

While this was marketed as AA Domestic First, the trip takes place in the 777's International Business cabin. AA has a great product here and there is plenty of storage and space within the seat. Food has also improved on AA with a decent meal being provided (you can pre order on AA.com, which is very welcome). AA also invited me to "Flagship Dining" in the Admirals Club as their Flagship Lounge is under construction at DFW. You don't normally get access to any lounges flying in Domestic First, but as I am a BA Gold member (until that runs out!), I was allowed in. 

Enjoy the report. 

Do you have any ideas for future trip reports? Something you've never seen on YouTube before? Why not suggest it to me in the comments? I read every single one! üëçüèª

Enjoy the video, and thanks for watching. If you subscribe, then thanks for being part of the channel!
